column5: Well, thanks for all the info guys. We ended up deciding on Made in Mexico, and when we got there it was closed. They are closed mon and Tues. Haha, we ended up going for a walk and had dinner at a beer house HBH. Had a great time regardless. Thanks again.
Sounds like a good first date!
Goin back for seconds I presume??????
Haha, of course. Any girl that orders and drinks a stout without flinching is good in my books.
I hope she likes fishing!!!!
Orchid Thai on Yonge St. is pretty reasonable and food is excellent! Nice atmosphere as well, was just there last night! Chinook is also excellent but a little pricier!

Anyone have a restaraunt they would share? Looking for something that isn't asian, has good food, quiet, can be out of the way of aurora but trying to keep somewhat local. Say from newmarket to richmondhill area. Not really looking to break the bank but not Mcdonalds either. Something in between. 20-25 dollar type entries are fine. umm yah so its a first date type thing so any other advice on a place to go in that area would be much appreciated... Toronto I have no problems finding somethign to do but I don't know the area.
Impress the heck out of her and cook something for her.
Made in Mexico . Newmarket. It's been showcased in a few shows , and is always packed . AWESOME food !!
Jonathans on yonge st. Aurora, havent been there in years but the food was good. Fairly nice quiet spot.
Made in Mexico . Newmarket. It's been showcased in a few shows , and is always packed . AWESOME food !!  X2

Anyone have a restaraunt they would share? Looking for something that isn't asian, has good food, quiet, can be out of the way of aurora but trying to keep somewhat local. Say from newmarket to richmondhill area. Not really looking to break the bank but not Mcdonalds either. Something in between. 20-25 dollar type entries are fine. umm yah so its a first date type thing so any other advice on a place to go in that area would be much appreciated... Toronto I have no problems finding somethign to do but I don't know the area. Forget local. Wanna make a kick arse impression? O.NOIR. Trust me. If shes in for a second date after that shes a keeper. You'll have a blast as well.  http://www.onoir.com/TO/frames.htm  Roy's idea is a great one considering you can make a hell of a meal for $50-60. Only one problem. If she takes a liking to you and the feeling isn't mutual she'll know where you live. Good luck Capt.
Half of my shift lives in aurora/newmarket, I can find out for you

just went to a new place across from hogan's inn.....its call ed locale...great food nice atmosphere....decent pricing....on keele south of king east side  or for a little less bucks  try gorgei porgie's in the no frills plaza in oak ridges  there isnt alot of good eats in the area but there are a few gems
Turtle Jacks on yonge north of eagle is good
There's Il Fornello on yonge, good food, prices are pretty good too!
There's a fantastic Italian place at Rutherford and Weston in Vaughan if you don't mind driving 15 minutes more
theres a few great italian places out there on weston rd...
Just received multiple texts suggesting Momma Mia's at Yonge and Davis

I would normally cook as I am a good cook but circumstances here warrant an eat out type thing. Too bad it's supposed to rain, I had a few good outside ideas. I think it'll be coffee and a meal. I will check out each of the spots you guys mentioned. Keep them coming though it may be a last minute decision. I don't even know what she likes. Haha. crap I hope she isn't a member of this forum. Rofl  And thanks.
The mexican place or goulash place on Main St in Newmarket. Also for BBQ Big Bone on Eagle St. I know you don't want asian food but I also like Pho Saigon or Cambodian Noodle in Newmarket.
Chinook restaurant in Aurora. And the name is even fishing related.
Can't help you with where to eat but I'm anxious to hear how the first date went
We have a winner!!!
Golden Bell Thai.  William Row/Yonge Street  Small and Intimate.  Reasonably priced as well.
Big Bone has good BBQ but not appropriate for a first date.  Unless she's a butch

"I would normally cook as I am a good cook but circumstances here warrant an eat out type thing"   Sounds like a "Plenty of Fish" type of date.    Good luck.  Hopefully you get a keeper right out of the gate! Sorry, not my area to recommend a place.
Haha, its a bit of  a story for another time. I think its gonna be a game time decision. I am leaning towards italian or mexican though.
first date ? Go Italian (better desserts and wine). If there's a second, Mexican  third date ? home cooking ftw !
King Richards Pub?  Used to go when it was King Henry's Arms.
If you go Italian do not order spaghetti there is no nice way to eat it lol. Good luck on the date though.   Art
